Sentencas: A modified Butler-Volmer equation for the reduction of CO2 by considering multi-step single-electron transfer reactions is presented.
Titulo: Modeling CO2 electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: Exchange current density formulations free from arbitrary order dependency on the partial pressures of reactants and products are proposed for Ni and Pt surfaces.
Titulo: Modeling CO2 electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: Button cell simulations are performed for Ni-YSZ/YSZ/LSM, Pt-YSZ/YSZ/Pt, and Pt/YSZ/Pt systems using two different electrochemical models, and simulation results are compared against experimental observations.
Titulo: Modeling CO2 electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: The first electrochemical model considers charge transfer reactions occurring at the interface between the electrode and dense electrolyte, and the second model considers the charge transfer reactions occurring throughout the thickness of the cermet electrode.
Titulo: Modeling CO2 electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cell

Sentencas: Single-channel simulations are further performed to asses the O-2 production capacity of CO2 electrolysis system.
Titulo: Modeling CO2 electrolysis in solid oxide electrolysis cell
